solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 2.7^2 = 218.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(2.7^2 cm^2 = 7.29 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 218.7 - 72.9 = 145.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 10 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(145.8 \times 10\)
= Rs. 1458

content.text: Five cubes of edge 2.7 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 10 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 486= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {486}{6}} \right) = 9 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 486 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (5 \times 3 + 3 \times 5 + 5 \times 5) = 110 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 9 boxes \(= 110 \times 9\)
\(= 990 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(5 cm \times 3 cm \times 5 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 9 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 1664 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(1664 m^2\)
Therefore, \(1664 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{1664}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{16}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 4 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (18 \times 10 + 10 \times 11 + 18 \times 11) = 976 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 1.2 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(976 \times 1.2\)
= Rs. 1171.2

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 1.2 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(18 cm \times 10 cm \times 11 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {9}2 \times 49 = 1386 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 1386 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 50 rolls \(= 1386 \times 50 = 69300 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 49 cm and its diameter is 9 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 50 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 384 cm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (112.5 + 37.5 + 75) = 450 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=15 dm, b=7.5 dm, c=5 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 4543 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=49 cm, h=5 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 1980 + 1716 + 352 = 4048 cm^2\)
